data.meanings: (Kaf-Alif-Ba) To drink out of a goblet.
data.sentence: The word وَأَكْوَابٌ comes from the root ك و ب and is associated with the meanings: (Kaf-Alif-Ba) To drink out of a goblet.

data.meanings: he put it or laid it in/on a place, put it or threw it down from his hand, opposite of Ra-Fa-Ayn, put down a thing, brought forth, to appoint, to impose/remit, give over, relinquish, lowered his grade/rank/condition, suffer loss, did not gain in it, lowered/humbled, depository, the proper place of a thing.
data.sentence: The word مَوْضُوعَةٌ comes from the root و ض ع and is associated with the meanings: he put it or laid it in/on a place, put it or threw it down from his hand, opposite of Ra-Fa-Ayn, put down a thing, brought forth, to appoint, to impose/remit, give over, relinquish, lowered his grade/rank/condition, suffer loss, did not gain in it, lowered/humbled, depository, the proper place of a thing.
